intro: Juncus requienii, commonly known as the Sierra junco, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Juncaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. It produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered at the tips of its stems. Juncus requienii is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
